alert.note: Alert for Addison (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 10 at 4:03PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central and southern Vermont, including the following counties, in central Vermont, Addison and Orange. In southern Vermont, Rutland and Windsor. * WHEN...Until 700 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 401 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. Between 3 and 6 inches of rain have fallen, with localized amounts near 8 inches. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Woodstock, Rutland, Chester, Bridgewater, Barnard, Stockbridge, Woodstock Village, Killington, Pomfret, Plymouth, Reading, Royalton, Bethel, Pittsfield, Hartland, Quechee, Mendon, West Windsor, Shrewsbury and Sharon. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
